Medium conviction overallâ€”upside narrative is compelling but technical deterioration is real.

key_themes: Monetary easing and AI productivity tailwinds driving growth/tech re-rating
Commodity exhaustion and distributionâ€”technical deterioration vs. bull narrative
Bifurcated market: strength in technology/innovation vs. headwinds in regulated financials
Earnings guidance credibility and breadth divergence signals
Geopolitical tail risk and regulatory enforcement pressure
risk_factors: Momentum divergence in silver and breadthâ€”distribution suggesting weakness ahead despite headline strength
Regulatory tightening and capital buffer announcements creating persistent headwind for financial sector
Earnings guidance cuts spreading beyond current pain pointsâ€”transitory vs. structural distinction unclear
Geopolitical escalation (Taiwan, Ukraine) as sudden risk-off catalyst overwhelming monetary accommodation thesis

analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Watch $700 call wall as active resistance (146k OI, 1.4% away). Support at $670 (45k OI, 2.9% awayâ€”active hedging). QQQ: $630 call wall (33k OIâ€”active resistance, 1.0% away), $625 and $640 both within 2.6% with meaningful OIâ€”expect choppy consolidation near these levels. Key test: whether bullish technical defense of $670 SPY and $625 QQQ holds or gives way to dormant support testing ($640 SPY, $590 QQQ). Monitor options expiration mechanics early January around the specified levels (MSTR, SLV, JPM, GOOGL, NFLX).
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: Bullish bias supported by Put Wall at $640 (153k OIâ€”robust downside cushion, 7.3% away). Target upside toward $730 (48k OI, 5.7%â€”dormant resistance) if momentum sustains. QQQ: Put Wall at $590 (164k OIâ€”strong support, 5.4% away) favors bounce/consolidation; resistance at $640 (31k OI, 2.6%â€”active). Max Pain gravity: SPY $686, QQQ $621 act as near-term attractors. 1-5 day moves likely constrained between active support/resistance zones unless technical breakdown (silver/momentum divergence) triggers waterfall. Upside scenario: consolidation holding $670+ SPY, $625+ QQQ, then test $700/$630 call walls. Downside scenario: failure to defend active support levels cascades toward dormant put walls.
